full_summary:
### ICN 13521: Supply Arrangement for Propane Forklifts

#### Information for Respondents

The Department of National Defence has a requirement for the procurement of five (5) Propane Forklifts and ancillary items. The procurement will be conducted through a Request for Proposal (RFP) against Supply Arrangement E60HS-21FRK/HS, Group 1A, Configuration A, B, C, D.

#### Solicitation Details

- **Solicitation Reference**: W8476-236679/A
- **Publication Date**: 14th June 2023
- **Tender Closing Date**: 5th July 2023 at 2:00 PM ET
- **Expected Contract Start Date**: None
- **Expected Contract End Date**: None
- **Tender Status**: Expired

#### Pre-qualification requirements

Suppliers must be registered with the federal contracting authorities. Respondents can find more information on the pre-qualification process here: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities/tender-notice/pw-hs-653-79868

#### Procurement Details

- **Procurement Category**: Goods and Services - Defence
- **UNSPSC Classification**: 24101603 (Forklifts)
- **System of Preference**: World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA), Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA), and other international trade agreements.

#### Contact Information

For respondents interested in supplying services under this procurement notice, please contact:

Victor Shepstone
DLP 5-3-4-3
Tel: (819) 939-3040
Email: [victor.shepstone@forces.gc.ca](mailto:victor.shepstone@forces.gc.ca)

#### Procurement Objectives

The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Respondents may submit bid documents in either official language of Canada.

#### Submission Instructions

The procurement will be conducted through a competitive process. The notices are published on Buyandsell.gc.ca for a period of 15 calendar days. Respondents are encouraged to visit website for further information.

The delivery period for the requested goods is 120 days after contract award. The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Suppliers are advised to review the procurement documents carefully before submission. Successful respondents will be contacted directly to proceed with the contract. Please direct any queries to the contracting officer
